summary: Tested mobile touch handlers for '+' button to add child nodes. Touch handlers (onPointerDown, onTouchEnd) are correctly implemented and WORKING. Successfully created new nodes via touch dispatch on mobile viewport (390x844). Tested in Demo mode and with authenticated user on PENDIENTES project.

issues: '+' button can be positioned at edge of viewport (x=385 on 390px screen) making it harder to tap - consider adjusting button position calculation for mobile

critical_code_review_comments: ✅ Touch handlers correctly implemented on all '+' buttons (lines 853-893, 896-984, 987-1063)
✅ onPointerDown checks for e.pointerType === 'touch' and calls handler
✅ CSS classes include 'touch-manipulation' and 'select-none' for better touch handling
✅ Button size is larger on mobile (w-10 h-10) vs desktop (md:w-8 md:h-8)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Touch handlers for '+' button are working. Tested on mobile viewport 390x844. The fix added onPointerDown and onTouchEnd handlers to all '+' buttons in Canvas.jsx. Demo mode can be used for quick testing without login.
